results.title: Kelly
results.creator_credit: Impala Films, Heritage Films and Alistair Matheson
results.brief_description: The story of the life and times of Captain James Kelly 1791-1851, who became an apprentice sailor at the age of thirteen in Sydney and who later became known as the father of Australian whaling. Kelly settled in Tasmania where he married and raised a family, prospered financially, but died at the age of sixty after experiencing financial ruin.

results.title: Kellie McGregor: animation
results.brief_description: Freak Magnet: the narrator is one unlucky individual - as is evident as she recounts her experience of meeting freaks and wackos in movie theatres, as housemates, and at the train station. Written produced and narrated by Kellie McGregor. Advertisements for yogo dairy snack and the dog food schmakos as animated by Kellie McGregor accompany the first short. Note: Individual titles are listed on the cover as ‘Freak magnet’, ‘Flying gherkin’ and ‘Commercial history’.

results.title: Keeping your teeth healthy
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Hugh Johnston and Suzanne Johnston
results.brief_description: A positive approach to the care of teeth, noting the functions of the different kinds of teeth and the role of nutrition in keeping teeth healthy. Stresses the need for regular dental care and visits to the dentist.

results.title: Keeping wool in shape
results.brief_description: Examines Australian advances in wool science from new methods of washing and spinning raw wool to technologically advanced techniques for dyeing, shrinkproofing and printing wool textiles. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.description: Examines Australian advances in wool science from new methods of washing and spinning raw wool to technologically advanced techniques for dyeing, shrinkproofing and printing wool textiles. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Keeping warm
results.brief_description: Examines the problems involved in keeping people warm. Humans generate their own body heat and try to keep warm by trapping heat next to the body with layers of clothing. Houses too need proper insulation if they are to retain the warmth from heating sources. This program looks at a computer- controlled house where getting up, having a bath and watching television happen to order; saving energy and money.

results.title: Keeping up with the Joneses
results.creator_credit: Rob Brow Productions, Film Australia, Peter Johnson and Rob Brow
results.brief_description: Nancy and Jonah Jones live on the Mallee Track. He is a pig-breeder and producer and she is a mother of four young children. They are heavily involved in various arts for children and adults in a culturyally isoldated area. Deals with their busy lives as farmers, parents, teachers and art consultants.

results.title: Keeping time
results.creator_credit: Amber Collective, Lorna Powell, Sirkka Konttinen and Peter Roberts
results.brief_description: Integrates documentary footage and dramatised sequences in dealing with mother and daughter relationships. Particular reference is given to the influence of television on the family structure and shows how the mothers want their daughters to better themselves through the local dance studio.

results.title: Keeping the faith
results.creator_credit: Koch Co, Norton Blumberg Productions, Edward Norton, Stuart Blumberg and Howard W. Koch
results.brief_description: With friendship and love as the key themes, this romantic comedy is refreshingly adult in its interrogation of two men (a priest and a rabbi) who fall for the same woman. Ben Stiller is utterly believable as Jacob Schram, an ambitious but highly personable rabbi whose faith and community are outright central to his life and value system. All this comes under threat however when he falls for Anna, a childhood friend who is not Jewish. She falls for Jacob hard but unbeknownst to both of them their mutual friend Brian (Edward Norton, who also has director duties) has serious designs on Anna, which sparks a moral and religious dilemma for the celibate priest. Also stars Eli Wallach, Anne Bancroft and Milos Foreman as mentors to the three troubled youth.

results.title: Keeping people alive: malnutrition - the hidden killer
results.creator_credit: World Focus, Alan Hart and Ian McFarlane
results.brief_description: Malnutrition kills 15 million young children each year and damages countless more. It slowly erodes physical and mental health. More help is needed from rich nations. From “Five minutes to midnight” (Title code 506172).
